summary:
Apple Fitness Plus Partners with Strava for Enhanced Integration

Publication Date: January 3

Apple Fitness Plus and Strava have announced a new integration that enhances workout features for users of both platforms.

This integration will provide detailed workout summaries, personalized content, and unique appearances by athletes from the Strava community.

  • Seamless integration of Apple Fitness Plus workouts into the Strava app.
  • Users will now see thumbnails of workouts, including important details like episode numbers, music genres, and trainers.
  • Strava users can access a three-month free trial of Fitness Plus.
  • Featured athletes from Strava will appear in special Fitness Plus workouts.
  • Future enhancements may include more features that connect users with their friends on Strava.
“This collaboration helps to bring Fitness Plus more in line with other Strava integrations and offer a deeper, more cohesive experience for athletes who want to track every aspect of their fitness journey.” - Jay Blahnik, Apple’s VP of Fitness Technologies

This partnership not only improves functionality but also aims to diversify the fitness routines of users, signaling a shift in how Apple has traditionally offered its Fitness Plus trials.

Google Shows How To Confirm Indexing Issues Due To JavaScript - Search Engine Journal
summary:
Google Demonstrates How to Address Indexing Issues Related to JavaScript

Publication Date: Recent

Source: SearchNorwich

Google's Martin Splitt explains how to identify and debug crawling and indexing issues associated with JavaScript, emphasizing that these problems are usually not caused by JavaScript itself.

  • JavaScript is not typically the root cause of SEO issues.
  • Confirmation bias can lead SEOs to wrongly attribute SEO problems to JavaScript.
  • Martin Splitt offers tools for diagnosing rendering issues, including Google Search Console and Chrome Dev Tools.
  • He suggests that many misunderstandings arise from a lack of knowledge about how to debug JavaScript.

“…it seems to me, as someone on the Google side of things, that SEOs look for clues that allow them to blame things they’re seeing on JavaScript.” - Martin Splitt

In conclusion, understanding JavaScript debugging can save valuable time and better address the actual SEO issues faced by websites.
newTitle: Google Demonstrates How to Address Indexing Issues Related to JavaScript

title: Nazi ties to Credit Suisse ran deeper than was known, hidden files reveal - Mint
summary:
Nazi ties to Credit Suisse ran deeper than was known, hidden files reveal

Published on: [Insert Date] | Source: Company Business News

Newly discovered documents indicate that Switzerland's past with Nazi collaborators may have been obscured, revealing deeper connections of Credit Suisse with the Nazi regime than previously acknowledged.

  • A cache of client files labeled 'American blacklist' was uncovered, indicating potential financing or trading with Nazis.

"Switzerland thought it came to terms with its Nazi-assisting past… Documents unearthed… show it might have been at least in part a whitewash."

This revelation may prompt a reevaluation of Swiss banks' roles during WWII and their implications for historical accountability.
